<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/retailers-prepare-holiday-season-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Brew's Egregiously Early Holiday Preview
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Pumpkin with a mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDExL3B1bXBraW5fd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got seven days until fall, but temperatures dipped below 70 last Thursday so we’re already slipping peppermint creamer into our coffee. To kick off this holiday preview, let's first check in with Captain Obvious. Captain? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Celebrations will look different</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nearly three-quarters of adults expect smaller holiday gatherings with friends and family because of Covid-19, according to a Morning Consult <a href="https://morningconsult.com/form/2020-holiday-shopping/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">survey</a>. About half expect virtual celebrations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First up, Halloween. </strong>If grocery aisles could talk, they’d say 1) Halloween is already in full swing, and 2) there’s still a contingent of you who willingly buy Butterfingers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With 10% of annual sales at risk, Hershey is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hershey-maps-trick-or-treating-risks-in-hopes-coronavirus-wont-scare-off-halloween-sales-11600097275?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working</a> with public health experts on a trick-or-treating website showing county-level coronavirus risks. Lawmakers have <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/house/514424-lawmakers-press-cdc-for-guidance-on-celebrating-halloween-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> the CDC to release Halloween guidance, including alternatives like drive-through trick-or-treating. And LA County <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/house/514424-lawmakers-press-cdc-for-guidance-on-celebrating-halloween-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">advised</a> residents to move costume parties to Zoom. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To play Devil’s advocate (ha), Halloween is literally built around masks and individually packaged treats…</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Next stop, Thanksgiving.</strong> Marching band parents exhaled a sigh of relief after Macy’s <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/macy-s-thanksgiving-day-parade-going-virtual-fall-due-coronavirus-n1240024?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a TV-only parade yesterday. It'll pre-record segments with fewer participants and sub in specialty vehicles to lug the balloons. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Retailers are adapting</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Holiday spending <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/extended-holiday-season-is-no-gift-for-retailers-11599919380?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accounts</a> for ~20% of U.S. retail sales and has increased every year since 2002...except 2008. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the pandemic, 2020 spending could take a dip, especially without additional stimulus checks or padded unemployment benefits. But, with less travel and dining out, it could also go up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Either way, retailers aren't waiting until Black Friday to find out. On October 10, more than two dozen are reportedly <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/14/us-retailers-developing-october-sales-holiday-bloomberg-reports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">participating</a> in a new holiday discount event mirroring Alibaba's Singles' Day in China. Home Depot, Macy’s, Walmart, Target, and American Eagle are moving their holiday seasons up. And Amazon Prime Day, typically held in the summer, is reportedly rescheduled for Oct. 26.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting early helps spread out crowds and process orders before holiday shipping surcharges take effect in November. But companies are still bulking up for the busy season: UPS and FedEx are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/11/hiring-begins-for-hundreds-of-thous-of-roles-for-holiday-shopping-season.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hiring</a> a combined 170,000 seasonal workers; Amazon said yesterday it's hiring 100,000 full and part-time employees.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/oracletiktok-deal-partnership-less-sale?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oracle and TikTok, One Day Later
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Hangover GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=282 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3owzW9t7Fgt7JiFHfW/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Hangover GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3owzW9t7Fgt7JiFHfW/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the bidding war for TikTok was high on drama, the winning Oracle deal is <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/14/21436035/tiktok-oracle-deal-bytedance-president-trump-safety?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">low on specifics</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here’s what we know</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Oracle isn’t buying TikTok.</strong> Instead, the enterprise software company is expected to operate as the “trusted tech partner” of TikTok in the U.S. The announcement reaffirms that TikTok’s most valuable asset, its powerful recommendation algorithm, is unlikely to be part of the deal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>So what </span><span><em>is</em></span><span> the deal? It’s still evolving, but Oracle would likely house data from U.S. TikTok users on its </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/oracle-tiktok-bid-heads-u-141740618.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">own cloud servers</a></span><span> to alleviate some of the national security concerns that prompted the Trump administration to call for a sale, Bloomberg reports.   </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin also floated the idea that TikTok could open a “TikTok Global” HQ in the U.S. and create 20,000 jobs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the deal <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-drops-out-of-bidding-for-tiktoks-u-s-operations-11600039821?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be reviewed</a> by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the U.S. (CFIUS) in the coming days before President Trump provides the final sign off.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CORPORATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/biggest-feuds-business-right-now?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Business Beefs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sometimes relationships in the business world are less SpongeBob and Patrick and more SpongeBob and Plankton. Here’s the latest on the biggest beefs in business.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nikola vs. short sellers: </strong>Nikola, the upstart electric truck maker, released its <a href="https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/nikola-electric-hydrogen-truck-trevor-milton-fraud/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defense</a> after short-seller Hindenburg Research called it an “intricate fraud” last week. In the 2,700-word rebuttal, Nikola called the report a “hit job,” however it did concede a few key Hindenburg criticisms. The SEC is now <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-14/sec-to-examine-nikola-nkla-over-short-seller-s-fraud-allegations?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigating</a> Nikola over these fraud allegations, reports Bloomberg.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Whistleblower vs. Facebook: </strong>In a <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-ignore-political-manipulation-whitstleblower-memo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">memo</a> obtained by BuzzFeed News, ex-Facebook data scientist Sophie Zhang alleges the company failed to respond to evidence that fake accounts were undermining political affairs in countries all over the world.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Arm vs. Arm cofounder: </strong>TikTok-Oracle may be grabbing the headlines, but Nvidia’s $40 billion deal for UK chip designer Arm might be beefier. Arm’s cofounder Hermann Hauser wrote an open letter to British Prime Minister Boris Johnson asking that he <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/14/arm-co-founder-starts-save-arm-campaign-to-keep-independence-amid-40b-nvidia-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">intervene</a> in the deal to protect UK jobs and economic interests.</p>

SPONSORED BY BLACKROCK
</h3>

<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Should Companies Lead With Purpose Through Crisis?
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="BlackRock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNzgxLzE1OTkyNDIzNjctUHVycG9zZV8xNTAweDcwMC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What impact can a purpose-driven company make on society? On <a href="https://bs.serving-sys.com/serving/adServer.bs?cn=trd&mc=click&pli=29928665&PluID=0&ord=[timestamp]" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this episode</a> of <em>The Bid</em> podcast, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky sits down with BlackRock Chief Marketing Officer Frank Cooper to talk about <strong style="color:#000">why purpose matters</strong>, how Airbnb has put purpose at the forefront of its decision-making, and <strong style="color:#000">how companies can lead through the Covid-19 crisis.</strong></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/biden-tax-plan-analysis-shows-minimal-changes-middleclass-earners?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who (Doesn’t) Want to Be a Millionaire?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Joe Biden" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDEzL2pvZV9iaWRlbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/22007612@N05" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gage Skidmore</a> from Surprise, AZ, United States of America, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Joe_Biden_(49554623208).jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Joe Biden (49554623208)</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If your annual income is <$400,000, feel free to skip to the end of this story because you won’t see major changes in your taxes if Joe Biden wins this November. If you earn more...pay attention.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Roughly 80% of Biden’s proposed tax increases would fall on the top 1% of earners, according to an <a href="https://budgetmodel.wharton.upenn.edu/issues/2020/9/14/biden-2020-analysis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">analysis</a> by the nonpartisan Penn Wharton Budget Model. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What about the top </span><span><em>0.1%</em></span><span>? Glad you asked. Biden’s plan would up their income tax rate to 43% from nearly 31% currently. The top 0.1% = people making more than $3.3 million annually.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden also wants to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/capital-gains-tax-rate-chasm-separates-trump-biden-11597409062?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20200914&instance_id=22171&nl=dealbook&regi_id=93038932&segment_id=38014&te=1&user_id=66da940ab69eee45ab6350f78ec61ee6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increase</a> the capital gains tax rate (levied on profits from asset sales) to nearly 40% for Americans earning $1+ million. President Trump wants to drop that rate to 15% from 23.8%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means for the budget: </strong>Through 2030, Biden would raise nearly $3.4 trillion in additional tax revenue but boost spending by $5.4 trillion. The two biggest line items under the plan are education and infrastructure.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite Trump’s claims otherwise, middle-class families would be largely unaffected by Biden's tax plan, per Wharton's analysis.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BEVERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/pepsico-takes-first-step-new-beverage-category-targets-restless-sleepers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
PepZzzzzzzCo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Driftwell by Pepsi" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDEyL2RyaWZ0d2VsbF9ieV9wZXBzaS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PepsiCo</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the biggest bedtime innovation since ad-free Counting Sheep Premium, consumer goods giant PepsiCo is releasing an <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/14/pepsico-to-launch-drink-to-aid-sleep-as-consumers-struggle-with-stress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enhanced water beverage</a> called Driftwell to help you sleep better.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Emerging from an employee incubator program, Driftwell went from ideation to production in under a year. The accelerated timeline comes as demand for “functional” beverages (those that provide value outside of just taste/nutrition) is on the rise, especially during a pandemic when people have <a href="https://www.today.com/health/why-am-i-so-tired-how-deal-exhaustion-during-pandemic-t182125?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struggled to sleep</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I think we’re launching this at a time when there’s more consumer interest than there previously was, given everything that’s going on from a macro perspective,” Pepsi VP Emily Silver told CNBC. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s in the can: </strong>The active ingredient is L-theanine, an amino acid found in some mushrooms and teas, that PepsiCo says achieved results in clinical testing. At 7.5 ounces, it’s intended to provide the perfect amount of hydration without forcing a midnight trip to the bathroom. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> As Big Soda confronts a <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90548696/pepsico-wants-to-help-the-caffeinated-masses-get-better-sleep-with-its-new-relaxation-drink?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decline</a> in the popularity of sugary drinks, moves into emerging categories like sleep and relaxation will become more common.</p>

But there’s no time for a water break, with the Fed’s policy announcement on Wednesday and the biggest week for IPOs since Uber went public.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnergy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA few \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/149db9416b78254c91b2b96877304788?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eominous signs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the world of oil. OPEC slashed its projections for oil demand this year and next, while BP said demand for crude will peak in the early 2020s.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nRETAIL \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Brew's Egregiously Early Holiday Preview\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Pumpkin with a mask\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDExL3B1bXBraW5fd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve got seven days until fall, but temperatures dipped below 70 last Thursday so we’re already slipping peppermint creamer into our coffee. To kick off this holiday preview, let's first check in with Captain Obvious. Captain? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCelebrations will look different\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNearly three-quarters of adults expect smaller holiday gatherings with friends and family because of Covid-19, according to a Morning Consult \u003ca href=\"https://morningconsult.com/form/2020-holiday-shopping/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurvey\u003c/a\u003e. About half expect virtual celebrations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFirst up, Halloween. \u003c/strong\u003eIf grocery aisles could talk, they’d say 1) Halloween is already in full swing, and 2) there’s still a contingent of you who willingly buy Butterfingers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith 10% of annual sales at risk, Hershey is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hershey-maps-trick-or-treating-risks-in-hopes-coronavirus-wont-scare-off-halloween-sales-11600097275?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking\u003c/a\u003e with public health experts on a trick-or-treating website showing county-level coronavirus risks. Lawmakers have \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/house/514424-lawmakers-press-cdc-for-guidance-on-celebrating-halloween-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e the CDC to release Halloween guidance, including alternatives like drive-through trick-or-treating. And LA County \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/house/514424-lawmakers-press-cdc-for-guidance-on-celebrating-halloween-during-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadvised\u003c/a\u003e residents to move costume parties to Zoom. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo play Devil’s advocate (ha), Halloween is literally built around masks and individually packaged treats…\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNext stop, Thanksgiving.\u003c/strong\u003e Marching band parents exhaled a sigh of relief after Macy’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/macy-s-thanksgiving-day-parade-going-virtual-fall-due-coronavirus-n1240024?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e a TV-only parade yesterday. It'll pre-record segments with fewer participants and sub in specialty vehicles to lug the balloons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRetailers are adapting\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHoliday spending \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/extended-holiday-season-is-no-gift-for-retailers-11599919380?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccounts\u003c/a\u003e for ~20% of U.S. retail sales and has increased every year since 2002...except 2008. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the pandemic, 2020 spending could take a dip, especially without additional stimulus checks or padded unemployment benefits. But, with less travel and dining out, it could also go up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEither way, retailers aren't waiting until Black Friday to find out. On October 10, more than two dozen are reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/14/us-retailers-developing-october-sales-holiday-bloomberg-reports?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eparticipating\u003c/a\u003e in a new holiday discount event mirroring Alibaba's Singles' Day in China. Home Depot, Macy’s, Walmart, Target, and American Eagle are moving their holiday seasons up. And Amazon Prime Day, typically held in the summer, is reportedly rescheduled for Oct. 26.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarting early helps spread out crowds and process orders before holiday shipping surcharges take effect in November. But companies are still bulking up for the busy season: UPS and FedEx are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/11/hiring-begins-for-hundreds-of-thous-of-roles-for-holiday-shopping-season.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehiring\u003c/a\u003e a combined 170,000 seasonal workers; Amazon said yesterday it's hiring 100,000 full and part-time style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOracle isn’t buying TikTok.\u003c/strong\u003e Instead, the enterprise software company is expected to operate as the “trusted tech partner” of TikTok in the U.S. The announcement reaffirms that TikTok’s most valuable asset, its powerful recommendation algorithm, is unlikely to be part of the deal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSo what It’s still evolving, but Oracle would likely house data from U.S. TikTok users on its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/oracle-tiktok-bid-heads-u-141740618.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eown cloud servers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to alleviate some of the national security concerns that prompted the Trump administration to call for a sale, Bloomberg reports.   \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTreasury style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSometimes relationships in the business world are less SpongeBob and Patrick and more SpongeBob and Plankton. Here’s the latest on the biggest beefs in business.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNikola vs. short sellers: \u003c/strong\u003eNikola, the upstart electric truck maker, released its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/nikola-electric-hydrogen-truck-trevor-milton-fraud/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edefense\u003c/a\u003e after short-seller Hindenburg Research called it an “intricate fraud” last week. In the 2,700-word rebuttal, Nikola called the report a “hit job,” however it did concede a few key Hindenburg criticisms. The SEC is now \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-14/sec-to-examine-nikola-nkla-over-short-seller-s-fraud-allegations?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigating\u003c/a\u003e Nikola over these fraud allegations, reports Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhistleblower vs. Facebook: \u003c/strong\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-ignore-political-manipulation-whitstleblower-memo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ememo\u003c/a\u003e obtained by BuzzFeed News, ex-Facebook data scientist Sophie Zhang alleges the company failed to respond to evidence that fake accounts were undermining political affairs in countries all over the world.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eArm vs. Arm cofounder: \u003c/strong\u003eTikTok-Oracle may be grabbing the headlines, but Nvidia’s $40 billion deal for UK chip designer Arm might be beefier. Arm’s cofounder Hermann Hauser wrote an open letter to British Prime Minister Boris Johnson asking that he \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/14/arm-co-founder-starts-save-arm-campaign-to-keep-independence-amid-40b-nvidia-deal/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintervene\u003c/a\u003e in the deal to protect UK jobs and economic interests.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS income is \u003c$400,000, feel free to skip to the end of this story because you won’t see major changes in your taxes if Joe Biden wins this November. If you earn more...pay attention.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRoughly 80% of Biden’s proposed tax increases would fall on the top 1% of earners, according to an \u003ca href=\"https://budgetmodel.wharton.upenn.edu/issues/2020/9/14/biden-2020-analysis?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanalysis\u003c/a\u003e by the nonpartisan Penn Wharton Budget Model. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat about the top \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e0.1%\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e? Glad you asked. Biden’s plan would up their income tax rate to 43% from nearly 31% currently. The top 0.1% = people making more than $3.3 million annually.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden also wants to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/capital-gains-tax-rate-chasm-separates-trump-biden-11597409062?campaign_id=4\u0026emc=edit_dk_20200914\u0026instance_id=22171\u0026nl=dealbook\u0026regi_id=93038932\u0026segment_id=38014\u0026te=1\u0026user_id=66da940ab69eee45ab6350f78ec61ee6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincrease\u003c/a\u003e the capital gains tax rate (levied on profits from asset sales) to nearly 40% for Americans earning $1+ million. President Trump wants to drop that rate to 15% from 23.8%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means for the budget: \u003c/strong\u003eThrough 2030, Biden would raise nearly $3.4 trillion in additional tax revenue but boost spending by $5.4 trillion. The two biggest line items under the plan are education and infrastructure.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite Trump’s claims otherwise, middle-class families would be largely unaffected by Biden's tax plan, per Wharton's style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eEmerging from an employee incubator program, Driftwell went from ideation to production in under a year. The accelerated timeline comes as demand for “functional” beverages (those that provide value outside of just taste/nutrition) is on the rise, especially during a pandemic when people have \u003ca href=\"https://www.today.com/health/why-am-i-so-tired-how-deal-exhaustion-during-pandemic-t182125?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estruggled to sleep\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I think we’re launching this at a time when there’s more consumer interest than there previously was, given everything that’s going on from a macro perspective,” Pepsi VP Emily Silver told CNBC. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s in the can: \u003c/strong\u003eThe active ingredient is L-theanine, an amino acid found in some mushrooms and teas, that PepsiCo says achieved results in clinical testing. At 7.5 ounces, it’s intended to provide the perfect amount of hydration without forcing a midnight trip to the bathroom. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
